instructions.text: Here and There are Adverbs of Place. They act like pronouns because they never take determiners and often appear as the subject of a sentence.
There
describes pictures, other rooms and places. Read the dialogue between the two women sitting on the couch.
Janice:
The climate control down here both heats and does air conditioning, so we close the windows at night to keep the mosquitos out, and we hunt them in the evenings with zap rackets.
Megan:
Oh that's so fun. I noticed you have a ladder in the attic.
Janice:
Yea we have all sorts of things up there. Some paint and supplies. Another radiator.
Megan:
I love the light and color up there
Janice:
But down here is nice too.
Megan:
What do you think of the color down here?
Janice:
Oh, it's fine too. Much more muted.
